[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 177]
Reasoning: **Shop Reroll Analysis**

Okay, Ante 6, Round 15. I've got $112. The goal is to beat Ante 8. Flushes (Level 4) is the current strategic focus. I need to keep the Jupiter consumable for the Perkeo synergy, which creates a negative copy at the end of the shop, this is key for scaling up. My current Jokers are Gros Michel (+15 mult), Droll Joker (+10 mult on Flushes/x1.5 mult), Perkeo (Crucial for the Jupiter), Blue Joker (+94 chips), and Ramen (x2 mult). I'm currently in the shop phase, and have Rocket (Foil) and 8 Ball available.

Given the Joker effects and the game's scoring order (Boss Blinds -> "On Played" Jokers -> Card Scoring (Chips, then Card Enhancements, then Card-based Multipliers, then 'On Scored' Jokers) -> Held-in-hand Jokers -> Independent Jokers (left-to-right)), I've worked out the optimal Joker ordering. Since I want +Mult applied before xMult, and since Droll Joker has both, the right order is Gros Michel (1), Droll Joker (2), Perkeo (3), Blue Joker (4), and Ramen (5). This ensures Gros Michel's +15 mult is applied first, then Droll Joker's +10 mult and x1.5 mult, and finally Ramen's x2 mult. The Blue Joker's chip bonus doesn't depend on its position in the list, since it's applied during the card scoring.

Regarding the shop cards, Rocket (Foil) seems tempting for the +50 chips, but Blue Joker already provides a larger chip bonus, and selling another Joker to take Rocket wouldn't be as efficient. 8 Ball, with its chance for a Tarot card, isn't compelling enough to replace any of my current Jokers.

Given my money ($112) and the cheap reroll cost ($3 due to the Reroll Surplus), rerolling the shop is the most logical move to hunt for better Jokers, Planet packs, or Tarot cards. I'm going to run through all other options first, though. No vouchers or boosters, I'll hold the Jupiter, and I won't sell anything. The Joker order is ideal. So, it's time to `reroll_shop`.



Command: reroll_shop

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

The goal is to maximize score and win the run, so I need to find better Jokers, Planet packs, or Tarot cards. I'm prioritizing Flushes, using Jupiter to level them up, and then leveraging Perkeo.

I'm thinking about the Joker order, just to keep everything straight. Right now, it's: Gros Michel, Droll, Perkeo, Blue Joker, and Ramen. Blue Joker adds chips, so position doesn't matter. The multipliers are applied in this order: +15, +10, then x1.5, and x2, so (+25) * 1.5 * 2. It's functionally fine for now, but I'm open to adjustments.
